pineapple enzyme can break down proteins into amino acids. Unfortunately half of the amino acids are bitter in themselves, so if you leave the meat too long in the juice, it can turn a bit bitter.
I broke down a chicken breast into liquid (fat+amino acids+water) with pineapple juice, the result was too bitter to eat unfortunately.
It would be much better to use an enzyme which breaks proteins down into polypeptides and not amino acids, that would solve the bitter taste, but I do not know about any.

The process for tenderising the beef was incorrect. The enzyme is predominantly located in the rind of the pineapple.
